availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard T. Whitaker (Shelby County, Kentucky, clerk and lieut, maj, lt col 6th KyInf USA)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, merchant, clerk, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of J. S. Whitaker. Merchant in Shelby County, Kentucky in 1850. Clerk in Shelby County in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant, major, and lieutenant colonel from April 11, 1862, to May 11, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 314A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 237.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 208.
